problem.p: Which of the following is NOT true about functions?

choicegroup.choice: Functions can have more than one inputs for the same output
Functions can have more that one outputs for the same input
Functions always give the same answer to a given input

div.p: Functions must have exactly one output unique to each input. For example, the a functions returns your age, then eveytime you call it for you (with your name as an input) you must get the same age, since your age is not fluctuating.
